name: biomni-create-scvi-embeddings
title: Biomni: Create Scvi Embeddings
description: Generate scVI and scANVI latent representations for single-cell RNA-seq data
content:
Overview

Generates scVI (single-cell Variational Inference) and scANVI (semi-supervised variant) latent representations for single-cell RNA-seq data. This deep learning-based method creates low-dimensional embeddings that account for batch effects, library size, and biological variation while enabling probabilistic modeling and uncertainty quantification of cell states.

Input Parameters

  • adata_file (string): Path to AnnData H5AD file containing single-cell expression data from stash
  • batch_key (string, required): Column name in adata.obs containing batch information for batch correction
  • label_key (string, required): Column name in adata.obs containing cell type labels for semi-supervised scANVI training
  • output (string): Output directory path

Input Format

Provide a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "adata_file": "/path/to/scrna_data.h5ad",
  "batch_key": "batch_id",
  "label_key": "cell_type",
  "output": "/output/directory"
}

Biological Use Case

Advanced integration method for complex single-cell datasets with multiple batches and cell types. Used for high-quality data integration in cell atlases, differential expression analysis with uncertainty quantification, imputation of missing values, and semi-supervised learning when some cells are annotated.

Output

Generates scvi_log.txt with model training metrics and scvi_emb_data.h5ad containing scVI/scANVI latent embeddings in adata.obsm for downstream analysis.

Category

genomics
